title: More Bits from Blinkbonny. ... Second edition
author: Strathesk, John
snippet: Alatthew Eiddell thought himself a very important man, for he had been appointed a member of the Whig committee. The committee rooms were in the Black Bull Hotel, and the laws against treating were practically ignored. Alatthew greatly enjoyed the driving about, the importance of his trust, and the refreshments.

title: Memoir of Robert Chambers /
author: Chambers, William
snippet: T T OW little are we able to penetrate the future ! The * * journey to Leith was not thrown away. In returning homewards, I had occasion to pass the shop of Mr John Sutherland, bookseller, Calton Street, an establishment opposite the Black Bull Hotel, the starting- place of the mail-coaches for London. In the window was the announcement, ' An Apprentice Wanted/ Here was the right thing at last.

title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: The negotiations and correspondings had all passed at a distance from me, but I recollect well our final practical parting on that occasion. A dim night, November or December, between nine and ten, in the coffee-room of the Black Bull Hotel. He was to start by early coach to-morrow.
